description.lang: FIBARO Dimmer 2 is a device designed to control various types of light sources in 2 or 3-wire connection. The device can switch or dim connected light source remotely using Z-Wave wireless protocol or through the wall switch connected directly to it. Dimmer 2 is equipped with a smart algorithm of light source detection which makes configuration easier and ensures high compatibility of the device. It may be used as a switch with non-dimmable light sources in 3-wire connection. Active power and energy consumption allows to monitor and reduce electricity bills. Dimmer 2 is compatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave Plus Controller.As a dimmer it operates under the following loads: 230V operated conventional incandescent and halogen light sources ELV electronic transformers (12V operated halogen lamps and dimmable LED bulbs) MLV ferromagnetic transformers with 12V operated halogen lamps dimmable LED bulbs dimmable compact fluorescent CFL tube lamps supported dimmable light sources with minimal power of 5VA (power factor > 0.5) using FIBARO Bypass FGB-002Without dimming function it may work with: compact fluorescent lamps fluorescent tube lamps with electronic ballast LED bulbs (power factor > 0.7) supported light sources with minimal power of 5VA (power factor > 0.5) using FIBARO Bypass FGB-002

Z-Wave Plus Lifeline. Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: SWITCH_MULTILEVEL_REPORT; DEVICE_RESET_LOCALLY_NOTIFICATION; SCENE_ACTIVATION_SET; METER_REPORT; SENSOR_MULTILEVEL_REPORT; NOTIFICATION REPORT.
Association Group On/Off (S1) is assigned to key no. 1. Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: BASIC_SET.
Association Group Dimmer (S1) is assigned to key no. 1. Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: SWITCH_MULTILEVEL_SET.
Association Group On/Off (S2) is assigned to key no. 2. Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated: BASIC_SET.
Association Group Dimmer (S2) is assigned to key no. 2. Type of frame sent by the device when the association group is activated:SWITCH_MULTILEVEL_SET.
The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.
percentage level of brightness
This parameter allows to automatically switch off the device after specified time from switching on the light source. It may be useful when the Dimmer 2 is installed in the stairway.
Function disabled
time to turn off measured in seconds (1s-9.1h)
Parameter allows for activation/deactivation of Z-Wave commands enabling/disabling all devices located in direct range of the main controller.
ALL ON not active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
Changing value of this parameter will force the calibration process. During the calibration parameter is set to 1 or 2 and switched to 0 upon completion.
readout
force auto-calibration of the load without FIBARO Bypass 2
force auto-calibration of the load with FIBARO Bypass 2
(read-only parameter) This parameter determines operating mode of the Dimmer 2 (automatic/manual settings).
calibration procedure not performed or Dimmer 2 operates on manual settings
Dimmer 2 operates on auto-calibration settings

Function based on the sudden power variation of a specific value, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR.CAUTION: Parameter 15 is relevant only when parameter 58 is set to 0 and the control mode is consistent with the mode set during the calibration process (parameter 30).
function disabled
percentage value of power variation, compared to standard power consumption, measured during the calibration procedure (to be interpreted as load error/burnt out bulb)

name.lang: Time delay of a burnt out bulb (parameter 15) or overload (parameter 39) detection

description.lang: Time of delay (in seconds) for power variation detection, interpreted as a LOAD ERROR or OVERLOAD detection (too much power connected to the Dimmer 2).
detection of a burnt out bulb disabled
delay time in seconds
If the parameter is active, switching on the Dimmer 2 (S1 single click) will always set this brightness level.
function disabled
percentage level of brightness

The parameter is set automatically during the calibration process. The parameter can be changed manually after the calibration.CAUTION: The maximum brightness level (parameter 2) must be greater than the minimum brightness level (parameter 1).
percentage level of brightness
Choose between momentary, toggle and roller blind switch.
momentary switch
toggle switch
roller blind switch - two switches operate the Dimmer 2 (S1 to brighten, S2 to dim)

name.lang: The value sent to associated devices on single click

description.lang: This parameter defines the value sent to devices associated with Dimmer 2 after its enabling.
0xFF value is sent, which will set associated devices to their last saved state
current Dimmer 2 state is sent, which will synchronize brightness level of associated devices (other dimmers for example)

name.lang: Assign toggle switch status to the device status

description.lang: By default each change of toggle switch position results in action of Dimmer 2 (switch on/off) regardless the physical connection of conntacts.
device changes status on switch status change
device status is synchronized with switch status

name.lang: Double click option - set the brightness level to MAX

description.lang: Sets reaction for double click - brightness level to MAX:0 - double click disabled1 - double click enabled.
double click disabled
double click enabled

name.lang: Command frames sent in 2nd and 3rd association groups (S1 associations)

description.lang: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups.NOTE: Parameter 24 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations onswitching ON or OFF the Dimmer 2 (single click) will not be sent.
all actions send to association groups
do not send when switching ON (single click)
do not send when switching OFF (single click)
do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing)
do not send on double click
send 0xFF value on double click

name.lang: Command frames sent in 4th and 5th association groups (S2 associations)

description.lang: Parameter determines, which actions will not result in sending frames to association groups.NOTE: Parameter 25 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that associations on switching ON or OFF the Dimmer 2 (single click) will not be sent.
all actions send to association groups
do not send when switching ON (single click)
do not send when switching OFF (single click)
do not send when changing dimming level (holding and releasing)
do not send on double click
send 0xFF value on double click
Switch no. 2 controls the Dimmer 2 additionally (in 3-way switch mode). Function disabled for parameter 20 set to 2 (roller blind switch).
3-way switch function for S2 disabled
3-way switch function for S2 enabled

name.lang: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode

description.lang: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st Lifeline group.NOTE: Parameter 27 values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure.
all groups (II-V) sent as non-secure
2nd group sent as secure
3rd group sent as secure
4th group sent as secure
5th group sent as secure
all groups (II-V) sent as secure

SCENE ID depends on the switch type configurations.NOTE: Enabling scene activation functionality may cause slight delay in response to external switches and sending associations.For more details check the manual.
functionality deactivated
functionality activated

name.lang: Switch functionality of S1 and S2

description.lang: This parameter allows for switching the role of keys connected to S1 and S2 without changes in connection.
standard mode
S1 operates as S2, S2 operates as S1

name.lang: Incandescence level of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps

description.lang: Virtual value set as a percentage level between parameters MIN (1%) and MAX. (99%). The Dimmer 2 will set to this value after first switch on. It is required for warming up and switching dimmable compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources.
percentage level of brightness

This parameter allows to set the desired load control mode. The device automatically adjusts correct control mode, but the installer may force its change using this parameter.Forced auto-calibration will set this parameters value to 2.CAUTION: Modifications of parameters in GROUP 30 should be performed only by a qualified installer.
forced leading edge control
forced trailing edge control
control mode selected automatically (based on auto-calibration)

name.lang: Load control mode recognized during auto-calibration

description.lang: Read only parameter.
leading edge
trailing edge

This mode is necessary while connecting non-dimmable light sources. Setting this parameter to 1 automatically ignores brightening/dimming time settings. Forced auto-calibration will set this parameters value to 2.
on/off mode disabled (dimming is possible)
on/off mode enabled (dimming is not possible)
mode selected automatically
This read only parameter contains an information about possibility of dimming the load detected during calibration procedure.
Load recognized as dimmable
Load recognized as non-dimmable
Time required to warm up the filament of halogen bulb.
no soft-start
short soft-start (0.1s)
long soft-start (0.5s)
This parameter determines the trigger of auto-calibration procedure,e.g. power on, load error, etc.
No auto-calibration of the load after power on
Auto-calibration performed after first power on
Auto-calibration performed after each power on

Auto-calibration performed after first power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 37 is set to 1 also after alarms: SURGE (Dimmer 2 output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (Dimmer 2 output overcurrent)

Auto-calibration performed after each power on or after each LOAD ERROR alarm (no load, load failure, burnt out bulb), if parameter 37 is set to 1 also after alarms: SURGE (Dimmer 2 output overvoltage) and OVERCURRENT (Dimmer 2 output overcurrent)

name.lang: Behaviour of the Dimmer 2 after OVERCURRENT or SURGE

description.lang: Occuring of errors related to surge or overcurrent results in turning off the output to prevent possible malfunction. By default the device performs three attempts to turn on the load (useful in case of momentary, short failures of the power supply).
device permanently disabled until re-enabling by command or external switch
three attempts to turn on the load
Reaching the defined value will result in turning off the load. Additional apparent power limit of 350VA is active by default.NOTE: Parameter 39 is relevant only when parameter 58 is set to 0.
functionality disabled

name.lang: Incandescence time of dimmable compact fluorescent lamps

description.lang: This parameter determines the time required for switching compact fluorescent lamps and certain types of light sources. Setting this parameter to 0 will disable the incandescence functionality.

name.lang: OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report

description.lang: Sets OVERHEAT (critical temperature) and VOLTAGE DROP (low voltage) alarm report:0 - No reaction1 - Send an alarm frame.
No reaction

This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the automatic control.NOTE:Automatic control is performed through: single push-button click; double push-button click; Z-Wave control frames.
dimming step percentage value
The parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report.
power reports disabled
(1-100%) power report threshold

name.lang: Periodic active power and energy reports

description.lang: Parameter 52 defines a time period between consecutive reports. Timer is reset and counted from zero after each report.
periodic reports disabled
(1-32767 seconds)
Energy level change which will result in sending a new energy report.
energy reports disabled
(0.01-2.55 kWh) report triggering threshold
The Dimmer 2 may include active power and energy consumed by itself in reports sent to the main controller.
Self-measurement inactive
Self-measurement active

name.lang: Method of calculating the active power

description.lang: This parameter defines how to calculate active power. It is useful in a case of 2-wire connection with light sources other than resistive.NOTE: Parameter 58 is set to 0 after forced auto-calibration.
measurement based on the standard algorithm
approximation based on the calibration data
approximation based on the control angle

name.lang: Approximated power at the maximum brightness level

description.lang: This parameter determines the approximate value of the power that will be reported by the device at its maximum brightness level.NOTE: Parameter 59 works only when parameter 58 has a value other than 0.
(0-500W) power consumed by the load at the maximum brightness level

name.lang: Automatic control - time of a dimming step

description.lang: This parameter defines the time of single dimming step set in parameter 5 during the automatic control.NOTE:Automatic control is performed through: single push-button click; double push-button click; Z-Wave control frames.
(0-2.55s, in 10ms steps)
This parameter defines the percentage value of dimming step during the manual control.NOTE: Manual control is performed through holding the push-button.
dimming step percentage value

name.lang: Manual control - time of a dimming step

description.lang: This parameter defines the time of single dimming step set in parameter 7 during the manual control.
(0-2.55s, in 10ms steps)

name.lang: State of the device after a power failure

description.lang: The Dimmer 2 will return to the last state before power failure.
the Dimmer 2 does not save the state before a power failure, it returns to off position
the Dimmer 2 restores its state before power failure
